This is likely a bug...

wrote:

> Returning to full-cell text-selection behaves oddly.
> Make two cells with code in them. Select the entirety of the text with the cell (or run it with ctrl+enter), and then focus to the next cell with either the mouse of keyboard.
> 
> Now, returning to the previous cell with the keyboard (ctrl-m p) works as expected. The text highlighting is the proper color, and you can move around as if the highlighted text is in focus.
> 
> Clicking on the cell, however, behaves strangely. It does not refocus the text, and single-clicking doesn't ever refocus the text. Navigating via mouse shouldn't behave that differently from keyboard navigation, with respect to the focus of contents of a cell, I don't think.
>

Hmm, I am also on Chrome (but 10.6.8).  Here is what I see:
- When I leave the first cell with text selected, the selected text
  gets greyed out.
- When I return using the keyboard (ctrl-m p is paste, how does that
  figure in?) the selected text turns blue and I can start to edit the
  cell.
- When I return using the mouse, the cell gets focused and the text is
  unselected.

What happens when you return using the mouse?  Are you clicking on the
cell border area or directly in the editor area?

This could be Chrome version issue (I am on 16.0.912.77).

Cheers,

Brian

Brian E. Granger
Cal Poly State University, San Luis Obispo
bgranger@calpoly.edu and ellisonbg@gmail.com

Here's a video of what happens: http://d.pr/Fgzh
First, I run the cell, then ctrl-m n to go to the next cell, and then ctrl-m p to go to the previous cell (the ctrl-m h help file labels that as previous, not paste for me). That works fine.

Then, in the next iteration, I ctrl-enter to run the cell, ctrl-m n to go to the next cell, and then try to return with the mice, with a single click. Every time I move the mouse and settle, I do a single click, until I double-click at the end.

Why would it matter if I'm clicking the border or in the editor? Is there a semantic difference that I'm missing?

I'm on Chrome 16.0.912.77 as well. I think Chrome aggressively auto-updates, which is nice.

Best,
Alex
